<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>INTERNAL CONTROLS AND PROCEDURES  
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Our Chief Executive Officer and Chief
Financial Officer have evaluated the effectiveness of our disclosure controls 
and procedures and internal control over
financial reporting as defined in Rule&nbsp;13a&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;15 under the 
U.S.&nbsp;Securities Exchange Act of 1934 and as defined in Canada under 
National
Instrument&nbsp;52-109, Certification of disclosure in Issuer's Annual and 
Interim Filings. Based on that evaluation, the Chief Executive Officer and Chief
Financial Officer of Enerplus Corporation
have concluded that, as at June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2015, our disclosure controls and 
procedures and internal control over financial reporting were effective. There 
were no changes in our internal
control over financial reporting during the period beginning on 
April&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2015 and ended June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2015 that have materially 
affected, or are reasonably likely to materially
affect, our internal control over financial reporting. </FONT></P>

REPORT</FONT><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;"><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;23 </B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>ADDITIONAL INFORMATION  
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Additional information relating to 
Enerplus, including our current Annual Information Form, is available under our 
profile on the SEDAR website at
<U>www.sedar.com</U>, on the EDGAR website at <U>www.sec.gov</U> and at 
<U>www.enerplus.com</U>. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>FORWARD-LOOKING INFORMATION AND 
STATEMENTS  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><I>This MD&amp;A contains certain 
forward-looking information and forward-looking statements within the meaning of
applicable securities laws
("forward-looking information"). The use of any of the words "expect", 
"anticipate", "continue", "estimate", "guidance", "objective", "ongoing", "may",
"will", "project", "should", "believe", "plans",
intends", "budget", "strategy" and similar expressions are intended to identify 
forward-looking information. In particular, but without limiting the foregoing,
this MD&amp;A contains forward-looking
information pertaining to the following: expected 2015 average production 
volumes and the anticipated production mix; the proportion of our anticipated 
oil and gas production that is hedged and the
effectiveness of such hedges in protecting our balance sheet and funds flow; our
commodity and foreign exchange risk management programs in 2015 and in the 
future; the results from our drilling
program and the timing of related production; oil and natural gas prices, 
including twelve month trailing prices used in calculation of a ceiling test 
impairment under U.S.&nbsp;GAAP; expectations
regarding our realized oil and natural gas prices; future royalty rates on our 
production and future production taxes; anticipated cash and non-cash G&amp;A, 
share-based compensation and financing
expenses; operating and transportation costs; capital spending levels in 2015 
and its impact on our production level; potential future asset impairments; the 
amount of our future abandonment and
reclamation costs and asset retirement obligations; future environmental 
expenses; our future royalty and production and U.S.&nbsp;cash taxes; deferred 
income taxes, our tax pools and expectations
regarding Canadian cash taxes; future debt and working capital levels and debt-
to-funds-flow ratio and adjusted payout ratio, financial capacity, liquidity and
capital resources to fund capital
spending and working capital requirements; our future acquisitions and 
dispositions, including timing thereof and expected use of proceeds therefrom; 
and the amount of future cash dividends that we
may pay to our shareholders.</I></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><I>The forward-looking information 
contained in this MD&amp;A reflects several material factors, expectations and 
assumptions including, without limitation: that we will conduct our
operations and achieve results of operations as anticipated; that our 
development plans will achieve the expected results; that lack of adequate 
infrastructure will not result in further curtailment
of production and/or reduced realized prices; current commodity price and cost 
assumptions; the general continuance of current or, where applicable, assumed 
industry conditions; the continuation of
assumed tax, royalty and regulatory regimes; the accuracy of the estimates of 
our reserve and resource volumes; the continued availability of adequate debt 
and/or equity financing and funds flow to
fund our capital, operating and working capital requirements, and dividend 
payments, as needed; the continued availability and sufficiency of our funds 
flow and availability under our bank credit
facility to fund our working capital deficiency; the availability of third party
services; and the extent of our liabilities. In addition, our 2015 guidance 
contained in this MD&amp;A is based on the
following July&nbsp;22,&nbsp;2015 forward prices: a WTI price of US$51.99/bbl, a
NYMEX price of US$2.89/Mcf, and AECO price of $2.75/GJ and a CDN/USD exchange 
rate
of&nbsp;1.27.</I></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><I>We believe the material factors, 
expectations and assumptions reflected in the forward-looking information are 
reasonable but no assurance can be given that these factors,
expectations and assumptions will prove to be correct. The forward-looking 
information included in this MD&amp;A is not a guarantee of future performance 
and should be unduly relied upon. Such information
involves known and unknown risks, uncertainties and other factors that may cause
actual results or events to differ materially from those anticipated in such 
forward-looking information including,
without limitation: changes in, including further decline of, commodity prices; 
changes in realized prices of Enerplus'
products; changes in the demand for or supply of our products; unanticipated 
operating results, results from our capital spending activities or production 
declines; curtailment of our production due
to low realized prices or lack of adequate infrastructure; our risk management 
programs, including commodity hedging, being less effective in protecting our 
balance sheet and funds flow than
anticipated; changes in tax or environmental laws, royalty rates or other 
regulatory matters; changes in our capital plans or by third party operators of 
our properties; changes in estimates of our
reserves and resource volumes; limited, unfavorable or a lack of access to 
capital markets; our inability to comply with covenants under our bank credit 
facility and senior notes; increased costs; a
lack of adequate insurance coverage; the impact of competitors; reliance on 
industry partners and third party service providers; failure to complete any of 
the anticipated acquisitions or
dispositions; and certain other risks detailed from time to time in our public 
disclosure documents (including, without limitation, those risks and 
contingencies described under "Risk Factors and Risk
Management" in our Annual MD&amp;A and in our other public 
filings).</I></FONT></P>

<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=29,EFW="2225646",CP="ENERPLUS 
CORPORATION",DN="2",CHK=903844,FOLIO='28',FILE='DISK132:
[15ZCB1.15ZCB16301]FG16301A.;6',USER='JATHANA',CD=';6-AUG-2015;16:57' -->
<!-- THIS IS THE END OF A COMPOSITION COMPONENT -->
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="page_fi16301_1_29"> </A>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"black" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DEFAULTFONT,"font-family:arial;" -->
</FONT> <FONT SIZE=5>NOTES </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=4>Notes to Condensed Consolidated 
Financial Statements<BR></FONT> <FONT SIZE=2>(unaudited) </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>1) REPORTING ENTITY  
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>These interim Condensed Consolidated 
Financial Statements ("interim Consolidated Financial Statements") and notes 
present the financial position and results of
Enerplus Corporation ("The&nbsp;Company" or "Enerplus") including its Canadian 
and U.S.&nbsp;subsidiaries. Enerplus is a North American crude oil and natural 
gas exploration and development
company. Enerplus is publicly traded on the Toronto and New&nbsp;York stock 
exchanges under the ticker symbol ERF. Enerplus' head office is located in 
Calgary, Alberta, Canada. The interim
Consolidated Financial Statements were authorized for issue by the Board of 
Directors on August&nbsp;6,&nbsp;2015. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>2) BASIS OF PREPARATION  
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Enerplus' interim Consolidated 
Financial Statements present its results of operations and financial position 
under accounting principles generally accepted in
the United&nbsp;States of America ("U.S.&nbsp;GAAP") for the three and six 
months ended June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2015 and the 2014 comparative periods. Certain 
information and notes normally
included with the annual audited Consolidated Financial Statements have been 
condensed or have been disclosed on an annual basis only. Accordingly, these 
interim Consolidated Financial Statements
should be read in conjunction with Enerplus' audited Consolidated Financial 
Statements as of December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2014. There are no differences in the 
use of estimates or
judgments between these interim Consolidated Financial Statements and the 
audited Consolidated Financial Statements and notes thereto for the year ended 
December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2014. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>These
unaudited interim Consolidated Financial Statements reflect, in the opinion of 
Management, all normal and recurring adjustments necessary to present fairly the
financial position and results of
the Company as at and for the periods presented. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>3) ACCOUNTS RECEIVABLE  
</B></FONT></P>
<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="56%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-
size:8pt;line-height:9pt;">($ thousands)</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-
size:8pt;line-height:9pt;">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-
size:8pt;line-height:9pt;">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="12%" ALIGN="RIGHT" VALIGN="BOTTOM" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  
style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;"><B>June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2015</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-
size:8pt;line-height:9pt;">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-
size:8pt;line-height:9pt;">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="6%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-

<P ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-

<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>The impairments for the three and six
months ended June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2015 were due to lower 12-month average trailing
crude oil and natural
gas&nbsp;prices. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>The
following table outlines the 12-month average trailing benchmark prices and 
exchange rates used in Enerplus' ceiling tests from June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2014 
through June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2015: </FONT></P>

<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=31,EFW="2225646",CP="ENERPLUS 
CORPORATION",DN="2",CHK=151942,FOLIO='30',FILE='DISK132:
[15ZCB1.15ZCB16301]FI16301A.;13',USER='JATHANA',CD=';6-AUG-2015;17:28' -->
<A NAME="page_fi16301_1_31"> </A>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>8) ASSET RETIREMENT OBLIGATION  
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Enerplus has estimated the present 
value of its asset retirement obligation to be $282.5&nbsp;million at 
June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2015 compared to
$288.7&nbsp;million at December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2014 based on a total undiscounted
liability of $698.2&nbsp;million and $730.9&nbsp;million, respectively. The 
asset retirement obligation was
calculated using a weighted credit-adjusted risk-free rate of 5.95% 
(December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2014&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;5.92%). </FONT></P>
<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>

<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>The difference between the expected 
income taxes based on the statutory income tax rate and the effective income 
taxes for the current and prior period is
impacted by the following: expected annual earnings, foreign rate differentials 
for foreign operations, statutory and other rate differentials, the reversal or 
recognition of previously unrecognized
deferred tax assets, non-taxable portions of capital gains and losses, and non-
deductible share-based compensation. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>(i) Long-term Incentive ("LTI") 
Plans  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>In 2014, the Performance Share Unit 
("PSU") and Restricted Share Unit ("RSU") plans were amended such that grants 
under the plans are settled through the
issuance of treasury shares. The amendment was effective beginning with our 
grant in March of 2014 and any prior grants will continue to be settled 
in&nbsp;cash. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>The
following table summarizes the PSU, RSU and Director Share Unit ("DSU") activity
for the six months ended June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2015: </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Cash-settled LTI Plans  
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>For the three and six months ended 
June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2015 the Company recorded a cash share-based compensation 
recovery of $1.2&nbsp;million and an
expense of $6.0&nbsp;million, respectively 
(June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2014&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;$10.6&nbsp;million expense and 
$17.5&nbsp;million expense). For the three and six
months ended June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2015 the Company made cash payments of nil and 
$5.6&nbsp;million, respectively, related to its cash-settled plans
(June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2014&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;$0.3&nbsp;million and 
$11.8&nbsp;million). </FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;"><B>ENERPLUS </B></FONT><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;">2015 Q2
REPORT</FONT><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;"><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;33 </B></FONT></P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:arial;page-break-before:always'></p>

<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Equity-settled LTI Plans  
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>For the three and six months ended 
June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2015 the Company recorded non-cash share-based compensation 
expense of $4.5&nbsp;million and
$9.0&nbsp;million, respectively (2014&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;$2.9&nbsp;million and 
$3.7&nbsp;million). </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>The
following table summarizes the cumulative share-based compensation expense 
recognized to-date which is recorded to Paid-in Capital on the Consolidated 
Balance Sheets. Unrecognized amounts will be
recorded to non-cash share-based compensation expense over the remaining 
vesting&nbsp;terms. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>At June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2015 
7,489,000&nbsp;options were exercisable at a weighted average reduced exercise 
price of $19.96 with a weighted average
remaining contractual term of 3.7&nbsp;years, giving an aggregate intrinsic 
value of nil (2014&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;$36.7&nbsp;million). The intrinsic value of 
options exercised
for the three and six months ended June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2015 was $0.1&nbsp;million
and $0.2&nbsp;million, respectively
(June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2014&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;$5.2&nbsp;million and 
$8.1&nbsp;million). </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>At
June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2015 the total share-based compensation expense related to 
non-vested options not yet recognized was $0.4&nbsp;million. The expense is 
expected to be recognized in net
income over a weighted-average period of 0.7&nbsp;years. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;"><B>34&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;ENERPLUS </B></FONT><FONT 
style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;">2015 Q2
REPORT</FONT></P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:arial;page-break-before:always'></p>

<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:arial;margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT  style="font-
size:8pt;line-height:9pt;">(1)</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  
style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;">For
the three and six months ended June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2015 the impact of share-based
compensation was anti-dilutive as a conversion to shares would not increase the 
loss
per&nbsp;share. </FONT></DD></DL>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>15) FINANCIAL INSTRUMENTS AND RISK
MANAGEMENT  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>a) Fair Value Measurements  
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>At June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2015 the 
carrying value of cash, accounts receivable, accounts payable, dividends payable
and bank credit facilities approximated
their fair value due to the short-term maturity of the instruments. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>At
June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2015 senior notes had a carrying value of 
$1,041.3&nbsp;million and a fair value of $1,121.0&nbsp;million
(December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2014&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;$1,057.0&nbsp;million and 
$1,150.0&nbsp;million, respectively). </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>There
were no transfers between fair value hierarchy levels during the period. 
</FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>b) Derivative Financial 
Instruments  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>The deferred financial assets and 
credits on the Consolidated Balance Sheets result from recording derivative 
financial instruments at fair&nbsp;value. </FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;"><B>ENERPLUS </B></FONT><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;">2015 Q2
REPORT</FONT><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;"><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;35 </B></FONT></P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:arial;page-break-before:always'></p>

<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>c) Risk Management  
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>(i) Market Risk  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Market risk is comprised of commodity
price, foreign exchange, interest rate and equity price&nbsp;risk. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Commodity Price Risk:  
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Enerplus manages a portion of 
commodity price risk through a combination of financial derivative and physical 
delivery sales contracts. Enerplus' policy is to
enter into commodity contracts subject to a maximum of 80% of forecasted 
production volumes net of royalties and production taxes. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;"><B>36&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;ENERPLUS </B></FONT><FONT 
style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;">2015 Q2
REPORT</FONT></P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:arial;page-break-before:always'></p>

<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Foreign Exchange Risk:  
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Enerplus is exposed to foreign 
exchange risk in relation to its U.S.&nbsp;operations, and U.S.&nbsp;dollar 
denominated senior notes and working capital.
Additionally, Enerplus' crude oil sales and a portion of its natural gas sales 
are based on U.S.&nbsp;dollar indices. Enerplus manages currency risk through 
the derivative instruments
detailed&nbsp;below. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><I>Foreign Exchange Derivatives:  
</I></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>During 2015 Enerplus entered into 
foreign exchange forward rate swaps for July through December&nbsp;2015 to buy 
US$6&nbsp;million per month at an average
US$/CDN$ exchange rate of 1.20 to partially mitigate losses on the foreign
exchange collars entered into in&nbsp;2014. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>During
2014 Enerplus entered into foreign exchange collars to protect a portion of its 
foreign exchange exposure on U.S.&nbsp;dollar denominated oil and gas sales with
upside participation in the
event the Canadian dollar weakened. As of June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2015 we have 
US$24&nbsp;million per month hedged for the remainder of 2015 at an average 
USD/CDN floor of 1.1088, a ceiling of 1.1845
and a conditional ceiling of&nbsp;1.1263. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>During
2011 Enerplus entered into foreign exchange swaps on US$175.0&nbsp;million of 
notional debt at approximately par. During 2015 Enerplus unwound these swaps and
recognized a gain of
$39.9&nbsp;million and an offsetting non-cash loss of $27.6&nbsp;million which 
have been included in foreign exchange gain/loss on the Consolidated Statements 
of Income/(Loss). </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>During
2007 Enerplus entered in foreign exchange swaps on US$54.0&nbsp;million of 
notional debt at an average US$/CDN$ exchange rate of 1.02. The remaining 
$10.8&nbsp;million notional amount under
the swap matures in October&nbsp;2015 in conjunction with the final principal 
repayment on the US$54.0&nbsp;million senior&nbsp;notes. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Interest Rate Risk:  
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>At June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2015 
approximately 93% of Enerplus' debt was based on fixed interest rates and 7% was
based on floating interest rates. At
June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2015 Enerplus did not have any interest rate derivatives 
outstanding. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;"><B>38&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;ENERPLUS </B></FONT><FONT 
style="font-size:8pt;line-height:9pt;">2015 Q2
REPORT</FONT></P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:arial;page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=39,EFW="2225646",CP="ENERPLUS 
CORPORATION",DN="2",CHK=783057,FOLIO='38',FILE='DISK132:
[15ZCB1.15ZCB16301]FK16301A.;11',USER='EREED',CD=';6-AUG-2015;19:19' -->
<A NAME="page_fk16301_1_39"> </A>
<BR>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Equity Price Risk:  
</B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Enerplus is exposed to equity price 
risk in relation to its long-term incentive plans detailed in Note&nbsp;14. 
Enerplus has entered into various equity swaps
maturing between 2015 and 2017 and has effectively fixed the figure settlement 
cost on 524,000&nbsp;shares at weighted average price of 
$16.51&nbsp;per&nbsp;share. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>(ii) Credit Risk  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Credit risk represents the financial 
loss Enerplus would experience due to the potential non-performance of 
counterparties to its financial instruments.
Enerplus is exposed to credit risk mainly through its joint venture, marketing
and financial counterparty receivables. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Enerplus
mitigates credit risk through credit management techniques including conducting 
financial assessments to establish and monitor counterparties' credit 
worthiness, setting exposure limits,
monitoring exposures against these limits and obtaining financial assurances 
such as letters of credit, parental guarantees, or third party credit insurance 
where warranted. Enerplus monitors and
manages its concentration of counterparty credit risk on an ongoing&nbsp;basis. 
</FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Enerplus'
maximum credit exposure at the balance sheet date consists of the carrying 
amount of its non-derivative financial assets and the fair value of its 
derivative financial assets. At
June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2015 approximately 63% of Enerplus' marketing receivables 
were with companies considered investment grade. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>At
June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2015 approximately $4.7&nbsp;million or 3% of Enerplus' total
accounts receivable were aged over 120&nbsp;days and considered past due. The 
majority of these accounts are
due from various joint venture partners. Enerplus actively monitors past due 
accounts and takes the necessary actions to expedite collection, which can 
include withholding production, netting amounts
of future payments or seeking other remedies including legal action. Should 
Enerplus determine that the ultimate collection of a receivable is in doubt, it 
will provide the necessary provision in its
allowance for doubtful accounts with a corresponding charge to earnings. If 
Enerplus subsequently determines an account is uncollectable the account is 
written off with a corresponding charge to the
allowance account. Enerplus' allowance for doubtful accounts balance at 
June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2015 was $2.7&nbsp;million
(December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2014&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;$2.7&nbsp;million). </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>(iii) Liquidity Risk&nbsp;&amp; 
Capital Management  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Liquidity risk represents the risk 
that Enerplus will be unable to meet its financial obligations as they become 
due. Enerplus mitigates liquidity risk through
actively managing its capital, which it defines as debt (net&nbsp;of cash) and 
shareholders' capital. Enerplus' objective is to provide adequate short and 
longer term liquidity while maintaining a
flexible capital structure to sustain the future development of its business. 
Enerplus strives to balance the portion of debt and equity in its capital 
structure given its current oil and natural gas
assets and planned investment opportunities. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Management
monitors a number of key variables with respect to its capital structure, 
including debt levels, capital spending plans, dividends, access to capital 
markets, as well as acquisition and
divestment activity. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>At
June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2015 Enerplus was in full compliance with all covenants under
the bank credit facility and outstanding senior&nbsp;notes. </FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>16) CONTINGENCIES  </B></FONT></P>
<P style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2>Enerplus is subject to various legal
claims and actions arising in the normal course of business. Although the 
outcome of such claims and actions cannot be
predicted with certainty, the Company does not expect these matters to have a 
material impact on the Consolidated Financial Statements. In instances where the
Company determines that a loss is
probable and the amount can be reasonably estimated, an accrual 
is&nbsp;recorded. </FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;"><B>ENERPLUS </B></FONT><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;">2015 Q2
REPORT</FONT><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;"><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;39 </B></FONT></P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:arial;page-break-before:always'></p>

<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="100%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="100%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT  style="font-size:8pt;line-
height:9pt;">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="86%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 style="font-family:arial;"><FONT 
SIZE=4><B>ABBREVIATIONS</B></FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="11%" style="font-family:arial;"><BR><FONT 
SIZE=2><B>AECO</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="87%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
a reference to the physical storage and trading hub<BR>
on the TransCanada Alberta Transmission System<BR>
(NOVA) which is the delivery point for the various<BR>
benchmark Alberta Index prices</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="11%" style="font-family:arial;"><BR><FONT 
SIZE=2><B>bbl(s)/day</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="87%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
barrel(s) per day, with each barrel representing<BR>
34.972 Imperial gallons or 42 U.S.gallons</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="11%" style="font-family:arial;"><BR><FONT 
SIZE=2><B>Bcf</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="87%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
billion cubic feet</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="11%" style="font-family:arial;"><BR><FONT 
SIZE=2><B>Bcfe</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="87%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
billion cubic feet equivalent</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="11%" style="font-family:arial;"><BR><FONT 
SIZE=2><B>BOE</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="87%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
barrels of oil equivalent</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="11%" style="font-family:arial;"><BR><FONT 
SIZE=2><B>Brent</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="87%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
crude oil sourced from the North Sea, the<BR>
benchmark for global oil trading quoted in<BR>
$US dollars.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="11%" style="font-family:arial;"><BR><FONT 
SIZE=2><B>LTI</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="87%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
long-term incentive</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="11%" style="font-family:arial;"><BR><FONT 
SIZE=2><B>Mbbls</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="87%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
thousand barrels</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="11%" style="font-family:arial;"><BR><FONT 
SIZE=2><B>MBOE</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="87%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
thousand barrels of oil equivalent</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="11%" style="font-family:arial;"><BR><FONT 
SIZE=2><B>Mcf</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="87%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
thousand cubic&nbsp;feet</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="11%" style="font-family:arial;"><BR><FONT 
SIZE=2><B>Mcfe</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="87%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
thousand cubic feet equivalent</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="11%" style="font-family:arial;"><BR><FONT 
SIZE=2><B>MMbbl(s)</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="87%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
million barrels</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="11%" style="font-family:arial;"><BR><FONT 
SIZE=2><B>MMBOE</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="87%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
million barrels of oil equivalent</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="11%" style="font-family:arial;"><BR><FONT 
SIZE=2><B>MMBtu</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="87%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
million British Thermal Units</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="11%" style="font-family:arial;"><BR><FONT 
SIZE=2><B>MMcf</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="87%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
million cubic&nbsp;feet</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="11%" style="font-family:arial;"><BR><FONT 
SIZE=2><B>MSW</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="87%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
mixed sweet blend</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="11%" style="font-family:arial;"><BR><FONT 
SIZE=2><B>MWh</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="87%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
megawatt hour(s) of electricity</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="11%" style="font-family:arial;"><BR><FONT 
SIZE=2><B>NGLs</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="87%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
natural gas liquids</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="11%" style="font-family:arial;"><BR><FONT 
SIZE=2><B>NYMEX</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="87%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
New&nbsp;York Mercantile Exchange, the benchmark for<BR>
North American natural gas pricing</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="11%" style="font-family:arial;"><BR><FONT 
SIZE=2><B>OCI</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="87%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
other comprehensive income</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="11%" style="font-family:arial;"><BR><FONT 
SIZE=2><B>SBC</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="87%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
share based compensation</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="11%" style="font-family:arial;"><BR><FONT 
SIZE=2><B>SDP</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="87%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
stock dividend program</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="11%" VALIGN="TOP" style="font-family:arial;"><BR><FONT SIZE=2><B>U.S.
GAAP</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT 
SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="87%" VALIGN="TOP" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
accounting principles generally accepted in the United&nbsp;States of 
America</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="11%" style="font-family:arial;"><BR><FONT 
SIZE=2><B>WCS</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="87%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
Western Canadian Select at Hardisty, Alberta, the<BR>
benchmark for Western Canadian heavy oil pricing<BR>
purposes</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="11%" style="font-family:arial;"><BR><FONT 
SIZE=2><B>WTI</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="87%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
West Texas Intermediate oil at Cushing, Oklahoma,<BR>
the benchmark for North American crude oil<BR>
pricing</FONT></TD>
</TR>

<TD WIDTH="7%" style="font-family:arial;"><HR NOSHADE></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=5>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="23%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT 
SIZE=3>Why&nbsp;invest&nbsp;in&nbsp;Enerplus?
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="65%" style="font-family:arial;"><HR NOSHADE></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="7%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=3><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=3><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=2 style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=3><BR>
Enerplus is a North American energy producer with a portfolio of high quality 
oil<BR>
and gas assets in resource plays that offer significant organic growth
potential. We<BR>
are focused on creating value for our investors through the execution of a<BR>
disciplined capital investment strategy that supports the successful development
of<BR>
our properties, and a monthly dividend to shareholders. We are a responsible<BR>
developer of resources that strives to provide investors with a competitive 
return<BR>
comprised of both growth and&nbsp;income.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="7%" style="font-family:arial;"><FONT SIZE=3>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
